justification: SLE is a multisystem autoimmune disease that can present with a wide range of symptoms, including oral ulcers, psychosis, pleural effusion, fever, and acute pericarditis.}, {diagnosis: Drug-induced lupus

justification: Certain medications can trigger a lupus-like syndrome, leading to symptoms like oral ulcers, psychosis, pleural effusion, fever, and acute pericarditis.}, {diagnosis: Infective endocarditis

justification: Infective endocarditis can cause embolic phenomena, leading to various symptoms, including oral ulcers, psychosis (from brain abscesses or stroke), pleural effusion, fever, and acute pericarditis.}, {diagnosis: Tuberculosis (TB)

justification: TB can affect multiple organs, including the lungs, heart, and brain, potentially causing oral ulcers, psychosis, pleural effusion, fever, and acute pericarditis.}, {diagnosis: HIV infection

justification: HIV infection can lead to opportunistic infections and malignancies, causing a wide range of symptoms, including oral ulcers, psychosis, pleural effusion, fever, and acute pericarditis.}, {diagnosis: Behçets disease

justification: Behçets disease is a rare autoimmune disorder characterized by recurrent oral ulcers, genital ulcers, and eye inflammation. It can also affect other organs, leading to symptoms like psychosis, pleural effusion, fever, and acute pericarditis.}, {diagnosis: Stills disease (Adult-onset Stills disease)

justification: Stills disease is a rare systemic inflammatory disorder that can cause fever, rash, arthritis, and serositis (inflammation of the linings of organs, including the pericardium and pleura). It can also cause oral ulcers and, less commonly, psychosis.}, {diagnosis: Wegeners granulomatosis (Granulomatosis with polyangiitis)

justification: Wegeners granulomatosis is a rare autoimmune disease that causes inflammation of blood vessels in the nose, sinuses, lungs, and kidneys. It can also affect the heart and brain, potentially causing oral ulcers, psychosis, pleural effusion, fever, and acute pericarditis.}, {diagnosis: Churg-Strauss syndrome (Eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis)

justification: Churg-Strauss syndrome is a rare autoimmune disease that causes inflammation of blood vessels in the lungs, skin, and nerves. It can also affect the heart and brain, potentially causing oral ulcers, psychosis, pleural effusion, fever, and acute pericarditis.}, {diagnosis: Lymphoma

justification: Lymphoma is a cancer of the lymphatic system that can affect various organs, including the heart, lungs, and brain, potentially causing oral ulcers, psychosis, pleural effusion, fever, and acute pericarditis.}
